body.p:
I take the opportunity at this
season of the year to write you a few lines
wishing you many happy returns of the
festivals & that you may be spared many
more years to defend Ancient Orthodox
Judaism in America, against the Anti
Jewish doctrines of the new lights.
I receive regularly your Occident, & feel
the same pleasure in reading it that I
always did in Cincinnati, Mr Lewis
Nathan, 10 Finsbury Circus, requests me
to say he wishes to become a subscriber,
that gentleman is one of the Parnassim of
the Great Synagogue, [The Synagogues here
are all conducted on Orthodox principles
with the exception of the Margaret St.
one, & that I am told does not increase
its number of members very rapidly, if at
all. The branch places of worship of the
Great & Portuguese Synagogues, in a great
measure having checked it, as formerly
numbers attended there who could not walk
the distance to the City Synagogues; They
have just reopened it with an Organ, like
all new customs introduced into Jewish Worship,
as established by our Sages, they must have
after a certain time a change, hence the
introduction of the Organ. The Portland
St. Synagogue a branch of the Great, divide
the morning Service, from the Reading of the
Law, Additional Service & Sermon, on Sabbath
& holidays with the exception of the

New Year & Day of Atonement. The
prayers for rain & dew have also been
curtailed in that Synagogue by the Sanction
of Dr. Adler the Chief Rabbi, but none of
the other Peyatim are abolished, the Second
service commences at ½ past 10 Oclock, it
is true this division makes a great many
attend service which never used, but at
the first service the Synagogue is almost
deserted there being hardly more than Minyan
attending, so that I believe the rising generation
when they grow up will almost forget there
is such a service as Shocras, it would be
much better to have both services together &
commence at 9 O Clock; In the country
most of the Congregations are small, I have
visited a great many of them, & strange to
say whereas in the United States the small
congregations increase rapidly, here they diminish.
At Manchester besides the orthodox congregation,
there is a seceding one the minister of
which was formerly minister of an orthodox
one but he having had a misunderstanding
with the members, became a seceder, did the
disagreement with the members of his former
congregation alter his religious views? I am
told a great many attend that Synagogue that
never before attended any but would not
the minister have been just as soon able to
have brought them there by introducing the
old Orthodox Portuguese Minhag, instead
of the Margaret St. Prayer Book.

Sussex Hall, the Jews & General Literary &
Scientific Institution is about to be closed.
The Jews College progresses well & I hope
at some future day to see it send forth

In concluding this letter I must say the Great
Synagogue has a very grand & Solemn appearance
on the Day of Atonement, there is something
in it that makes a person feel devout on
entering & without any organ to occasion those
feelings. There was only one person wanted &
that was our respected Chief Rabbi who was
absent being in ill health & ordered to the sea sick
but I am glad to say he is fast recovering, the
Revd. Mr. Ascher the Reader, performed the
services in the same impressive way that he
used ten years ago when I heard him. I
must now conclude giving you my best
wishes & hoping to hear from you,
